{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.21754v1", "title": "Virtual Atom-Photon Bound States and Spontaneous Emission Control", "summary": "In waveguide quantum electrodynamics systems, atomic radiation emission is
shaped by the photonic environment and collective atom interactions, offering
promising applications in quantum technologies. In particular, atom-photon
bound states, inhibiting complete spontaneous decay of the atom, can be
realized through waveguide dispersion engineering or by utilizing giant atoms.
While steady-state bound states are well understood, transient or virtual bound
states remain less explored. Here we investigate transient atom-photon bound
states, arising from initial atom-photon entanglement, and propose methods to
slow down spontaneous atomic decay.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph,physics.optics", "published": "2025-04-30T15:49:35Z"}
